citation.article-title: Desulfonispora thiosulfatigenes gen. nov., sp. nov., a taurine-fermenting, thiosulfate-producing anaerobic bacterium.

p.s: Description of Desulfonispora thiosulfatigenes sp. nov.
Desulfonispora thiosulfatigenes (thi.o.sul.fa.ti'ge.nes. M. L. n. thiosulfas thiosulfate; M.L. suff. genes -producing; M.L. part. adj. thiosulfatigenes thiosulfate-producing)
Rod-shaped bacteria, 2-5 x 0.7-1.0 Î¼m in size, motile, with subterminal spores.
High cytochrome b level in membrane fractions.
Growing only with taurine (out of 41 substrates tested), producing acetate, ammonia and thiosulfate.
Neither sulfate, sulfite nor nitrate is reduced.
In terms of phylogeny, the type species is a member of the Clostridium subline of descent, being remotely related to Peptococcus, Desulfotomaculum, Desulfitobacterium and Desulfosporosinus.

Strain GKNTAUT is the type strain and is deposited with the DSMZ (Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen und Zellkulturen) under DSM 11270T and with the American Type Culture Collection under ATCC 700533T.
